docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: LAST MARCH, TINA BROWN, EDITOR OF VANITY FAIR, JETTED OFF TO LOS ANGELES with a band of her star writers to throw a party at the Museum of Contemporary Art. The excuse was the recently opened Man Ray exhibition, but for Hollywood the bash served as a kind of finale to Academy Awards week. It was a hot ticket, a swank event jammed with the local swells: stars like Kim Basinger, artists like David Hockney, power brokers like Jeff Berg, International Creative Management's chief, and Don Simpson, co-producer of ''Top Gun.

headline.main: S.I. Newhouse and Conde Nast; Taking Off The White Gloves
